TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WizardStepCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.Collections.IList
Public NotInheritable Class WizardStepCollection Implements IList
public ref class WizardStepCollection sealed : System::Collections::IList
type WizardStepCollection = class interface IList interface ICollection interface IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of -derived objects in a control that acts as a wizard. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> class is used to store and manage a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived objects in a control that acts as a wizard, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CreateUserWizard> control or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control. For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> class for its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.WizardSteps%2A> property.
There are multiple ways you can access the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection>:
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Item%2A> property to directly access a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object at a specific zero-based index.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to create an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the contents of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection into an <xref:System.Array> object.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to populate the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection using declarative syntax.
[!code-aspx-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollectionDeclare#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollectionDeclare/CS/wizardstepcollectiondeclarecs.aspx#3)] [!code-aspx-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollectionDeclare#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollectionDeclare/VB/wizardstepcollectiondeclarevb.aspx#3)]
The following example demonstrates how to programmatically populate a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection.
[!code-aspx-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection/CS/wizardstepcollectioncs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection/VB/wizardstepcollectionvb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Add(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase wizardStep) cil managed

Docs.param: The -derived object to append to the collection.
Docs.summary: Appends the specified -derived object to the end of the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Add%2A> method adds the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object to the end of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection. To add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object to the collection at a specific index location, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.AddAt%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates programmatically creating a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control and using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Add%2A> method to add <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStep> objects to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.WizardSteps%2A> collection. Note that in the example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.WizardSteps%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> class.
[!code-aspx-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardSteps#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardSteps/CS/wizardstepscs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardSteps#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardSteps/VB/wizardstepsvb.aspx#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.AddAt%2A> method adds the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object to the collection at the specified index location.
To add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object to the end of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Add%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all -derived objects from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Clear%2A> method to remove all the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived objects from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection.
> [!NOTE] > After the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Clear%2A> method removes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived objects from the collection, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Count%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection has a value of zero.

This method is commonly used to test for the existence of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object before performing a task, such as removing a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object from the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyTo (System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase[] array, int index);
.method public hidebysig instance void CopyTo(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase[] array, int32 index) cil managed
Public Sub CopyTo (array As WizardStepBase(), index As Integer)
public: void CopyTo(cli::array <System::Web::UI::WebControls::WizardStepBase ^> ^ array, int index);

Docs.param: A zero-based array of objects that receives the items copied from the collection.
The position in the target array at which the array starts receiving the copied items.
Docs.summary: Copies all the items from a collection to a compatible one-dimensional array of objects, starting at the specified index in the target array.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the contents of the collection into the specified zero-based array. Items are copied starting at the specified index of the target array. After the items are in an array, you can use array syntax to access the items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection.
As an alternative, you can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to create an enumerator that can be used to access the items in the collection.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase> objects from the collection to an array. The array is then iterated through to display the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property of each <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object. Note that in the example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.WizardSteps%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> class.
[!code-aspx-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollectionCopyTo#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollectionCopyTo/CS/wizardstepcollectioncopytocs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollectionCopyTo#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollectionCopyTo/VB/wizardstepcollectioncopytovb.aspx#1)]

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Count%2A> property is commonly used when iterating through the collection to determine its upper bound.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the index of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object in the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object is not in the collection, the method returns -1.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Insert (int index, System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase wizardStep);
.method public hidebysig instance void Insert(int32 index, class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase wizardStep) cil managed
Public Sub Insert (index As Integer, wizardStep As WizardStepBase)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The index location at which to insert the -derived object.
The -derived object to insert into the collection.
Docs.summary: Inserts the specified -derived object into the collection at the specified index location.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Insert%2A> method adds the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object to the collection at the specified index location.
Alternatively, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.AddAt%2A> method to add the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object to the collection. To add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived object to the end of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Add%2A> method.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Insert%2A> method and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.AddAt%2A> method perform essentially the same function. When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Insert%2A> method is called, it simply passes the `wizardStep` and `index` parameters to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.AddAt%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates programmatically creating a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control and using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Insert%2A> method to add <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase>-derived objects to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.WizardSteps%2A> collection. Note that in the example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.WizardSteps%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> class.
[!code-aspx-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollectionInsert#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollectionInsert/CS/wizardstepcollectioninsertcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollectionInsert#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollectionInsert/VB/wizardstepcollectioninsertvb.aspx#1)]
